page.title: 14THE ELDERLY IN N.W.NEWCASTLE
page.content: { Kenton Hall}is a home for 33 elderly ladies, whose average age is 90.Four or five ladies share a bedroom and each floor has one toilet and a bathroom with a low sink.There is also a large dining hall and sitting rooms where the ladies spend most of their time talking,reading and watching television.The ladies need a lot of help,especially to get upstairs since there are no lifts. { St Clement's Court}provides sheltered accomodation for about 50 pensioners. The modern building has 45 flats and a common room.Everyone has a key but the outside door is locked at 10.30pm. for safety.There is a lift and an alarm for emergencies.The warden phones the residents each morning and a doctor calls on his rounds.The residents are very happy but think that services are too far away.
